Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of ϵ-Aminocaproic Acid Pharmacokinetics in Adolescents Undergoing Spinal Fusion

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised into two groups based on scoliosis diagnosis: idiopathic (n=10) and non-idiopathic (n=10).

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial enrolled 20 adolescents aged 12–17 years undergoing spinal fusion at a tertiary care center.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised into two groups based on scoliosis diagnosis: idiopathic (n=10) and non-idiopathic (n=10).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine EACA pharmacokinetics and recommend dosing in this population.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pharmacokinetic parameter estimation over the surgical period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised into two groups based on scoliosis diagnosis: idiopathic (n=10) and non-idiopathic (n=10).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomised into two groups based on scoliosis diagnosis: idiopathic (n=10) and non-idiopathic (n=10).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Parameters for a typical patient included plasma clearance of 153 ml min−1 70 kg−1, intercompartmental clearance of 200 ml min−1 70 kg−1, central volume of distribution of 8.78 litre 70 kg−1, and peripheral volume of distribution of 15.8 litre 70 kg−1.
